مقدونيا الشمالية‎ (Arabic), Maqedonia e Veriut (Albanian), Masadoinia a Tuath (Scots Gaelic), Masèdonia (Acehnese), Masedonya (Central Bikolano), Mazedonie (Alemannic), Mazedonien (Low Saxon), Noord-Macedonië (Dutch), Noord-Masedonië (Afrikaans), Nord-Makedonia (Norwegian), Nord-Makedonio (Esperanto), Nordmakedonien (Danish, Swedish), Nordmazedonien (German), Norður-Makedónía (Icelandic), Norðurmakedónia (Faroese), Nort Masidonia - นอร์มาซิโดเนีย (Thai), Pak Makedonija (Min Nan), Pivnična Makedoniya - Північна Македонія (Ukrainian), Põhja-Makedoonia (Estonian), Pohjois-Makedonia (Finnish), Severna Makedonija (Slovene), Severna Makedonija - Северна Македонија (Macedonian, Serbian), Severna Makedoniya - Северна Македония (Bulgarian), Severnaya Makedoniya - Северная Македония (Russian), Severné Macedónsko (Slovak), Severní Makedonie (Czech), Šiaurės Makedonija (Lithuanian), Şimali Makedoniya (Azeri), Uttara Maisiḍoniyā - उत्तर मैसिडोनिया (Hindi, Sanskrit), Vóreia Makedonía – Βόρεια Μακεδονία (Greek), Ziemeļmaķedonija (Latvian), Yvate Masendoña (Guaraní), மாசிடோனிய தெனார்[romanization needed] (Tamil)

        Formerly known as Macedonia: an Mhacadóin (Irish), il-Maċedonja (Maltese), Ma-xê-đô-ni-a (Vietnamese), Macédoine (French), Macedônia (Brazilian Portuguese), Macedonia (Aragonese, Asturian, Filipino/Tagalog, Italian, Latin, Polish, Romanian, Spanish, Welsh), Macedònia (Catalan), Macedónia (Hungarian, European Portuguese), Macedonië (Dutch), Macedónsko (Slovak), Mæsidoniyawa - මැසිඩෝනියාව (Sinhala), Maghdounieh - مقدونيه (Persian), Maisiḍoniyā - मैसिडोनिया (Hindi, Sanskrit), Makedonia – Մակեդոնիա (Armenian), Makedónia (Faroese), Makedonia (Finnish, Indonesian, Norwegian), Makedonia - מקדוניה‎ (Hebrew), Makedónía (Icelandic), Makedonia - マケドニア (Japanese), Makedonia / Mak'edonia - 마케도니아 (Korean), Makedonie (Czech), Makedonien (Danish, Swedish), Maķedonija (Latvian), Makedonija (Lithuanian, Min Nan, Slovene), Makedonija - Македонија (Macedonian, Serbian), Makedonio (Esperanto), Makedoniya (Azeri), Makedoniya - Македония (Bulgarian, Russian), Makedoniya - Македонія (Ukrainian), Makedonya (Turkish), Makedoonia (Estonian), Maqdūniyā - مقدونيا‎ (Arabic), Maqedonia (Albanian), Mǎqídùn - 馬其頓 / 马其顿 (Mandarin Chinese), Masadoinia (Scots Gaelic), Masedonië (Afrikaans), Masendoña (Guaraní), Masidonia - มาซิโดเนีย (Thai), Mazedonia (Basque), Mazedonien (German), Próen Yugoslavikí Dimokratía tis Makedonías – Πρώην Γιουγκοσλαβική Δημοκρατία της Μακεδονίας (Greek [Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, where Macedonia refers to the historical area of the ancient Hellenic Kingdom of Macedonia]), மாசிடோனிய குடியரசு[romanization needed] (Tamil)
        Note: The use of the name Macedonia was disputed by Greece. Local translations of the provisional appellation Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia were common in several languages.

        Northern Ireland ʾAyirlandā š-Šamāliyya - أيرلندا الشمالية‎ (Arabic), Bắc Ái Nhĩ Lan (Vietnamese), Běi-Ài'ěrlán - 北愛爾蘭 / 北爱尔兰 (Chinese), Bugaillaendeu - 북아일랜드 (Korean), Črdiloeti Irlandia - ჩრდილოეთი ირლანდია (Georgian), Èirinn a Tuath (Scots Gaelic), Észak-Írország (Hungarian), Gogledd Iwerddon (Welsh), Hilagang Irlanda (Filipino/Tagalog), Hyusisayin Iṙlandia - Հյուսիսային Իռլանդիա (Armenian), Ireland Utara (Malay), Irlând-e Šomâli - ایرلند شمالی (Persian), Irlanda de Nord (Romanian), Irlanda del Nord (Italian), Irlanda del Nort (Catalan), Irlanda del Norte (Spanish), Irlanda do Norte (Portuguese), Irlanda ta' Fuq (Maltese), Irlanda Veriore (Albanian), Irlande du Nord (French), Irlandia Północna (Polish), Irlandia Utara (Indonesian), Kita Airurando - 北アイルランド (Japanese), Kuzey İrlanda (Turkish), Noord-Ierland (Afrikaans, Dutch), Nord-Irland (Norwegian), Nord-Irlando (Esperanto), Nordirland (Danish, German, Swedish), Norður-Írland (Icelandic), Norðurírland (Faroese), Nothoen Ailaen - นอร์เทิร์นไอร์แลนด์ (Thai), Paŭnočnaja Irłandyia - Паўночная Ірландыя (Belarusian), Pivnična Irlandiya - Північна Ірландія (Ukrainian), Põhja-Iirimaa (Estonian), Pohjois-Irlanti (Finnish), Severna Irlandiya - Северна Ирландия (Bulgarian), Severna Irska (Slovene), Severna Irska - Северна Ирска (Macedonian, Serbian), Severnaya Irlandiya - Северная Ирландия (Russian), Severné Írsko (Slovak), Severní Irsko (Czech), Šiaurės Airija (Lithuanian), Şimali İrlandiya (Azeri), Sjeverna Irska (Bosnian, Croatian), Soltüstik Ïrlandïya - Солтүстік Ирландия (Kazakh), Tsafon Irland - צפון אירלנד‎ (Hebrew), Tuaisceart Éireann (Irish), Uttarī Āyarlaiṇḍ - उत्तरी आयरलैंड् (Hindi, Sanskrit), Uttôr Aẏarôljanḍ - উত্তর আয়ারল্যান্ড (Bengali), Vóreia Irlandía - Βόρεια Ιρλανδία (Greek), Ziemeļīrija (Latvian)
        Northern Mariana Islands Běi Mǎlǐyànà qúndǎo - 北马里亚纳群岛 (Mandarin Chinese), Bungmariana Jedo / Pungmariana Chedo - 북마리아나 제도 (Korean), na h-Eileanan Mairianach a Tuath (Scots Gaelic), Északi-Mariana-szigetek (Hungarian), Ǧazur Māryānā š-Šamāliyya - หมู่เกาะนอร์เทิร์นมาเรียนา (Thai), Noordelijke Marianen (Dutch), Nördliche Marianen (German), Nord-Marianene (Norwegian), Nordmarianerna (Swedish), Nordmarianerne (Danish), Nord-Marianoj (Esperanto), Notte Mariånas (Chamorro), Pak Mariana Kûn-tó (Min Nan), Paŭnochnyia Maryianskiia Vyspy -         Norway an Iorua (Irish), an-Nurwīj - النرويج‎ (Arabic), Naraoẏe - নরওয়ে (Bengali), Na Uy (Vietnamese), Nirribhidh (Scots Gaelic), Noorweë (Afrikaans), Noorwegen (Dutch), Noreg (Faroese, Norwegian-Nynorsk), Noregur (Icelandic), Noreuwei / Norŭwei - 노르웨이 (Korean), Norga (Sami), Norge (Danish, Min Nan, Norwegian-Bokmål, Swedish), Norja (Finnish), Norra (Estonian, Võro), Norsko (Czech), Nórsko (Slovak), Noruega (Aragonese, Asturian, Catalan, Guaraní, Portuguese, Spanish), Noruwega (Filipino/Tagalog), Noruwē - ノルウェー (Japanese), Nŏrve - नॉर्वे (Hindi, Sanskrit), Norveç (Azeri, Turkish), Norvèg·e (Franco-Provençal), Norvège (French), Norvegia (Basque, Italian, Latin, Romanian, Romansh), Norvégia (Hungarian), Norvegia - Նորվեգիա (Armenia), Norvehia - Норвегія (Ukrainian), Norvēģija (Latvian), Norvegija (Lithuanian), Norvegio (Esperanto), Norvegiya - Норвегия (Bulgarian, Russian), Norvegiya - נורבגיה‎ (Hebrew), in-Norveġja (Maltese), Norvegjia (Albanian), Norvegye - נאָרװעגיע‎ (Yiddish), Norveška - Норвешка (Macedonian, Serbian), Norveška (Slovene), Norvigía - Νορβηγία (Greek), Norway (English, Malay), Norway - නෝර්වේ (Sinhala), Norweege (Alemannic), Norwegen (German, Low Saxon), Norwègia (Acehnese), Norwegia (Indonesian, Polish), Norwegska (Lower Sorbian), Norwéy - ኖርዌይ (Amharic), Norwij (Bambara), Nowe - นอร์เวย์ (Thai), Norwy (Welsh), Nuówēi - 挪威 (Mandarin Chinese), Nuruwai (Inuktitut), நோர்வே[romanization needed] (Tamil)

        P

        Persia See Iran. Persia is the former name of Iran.

        Philippines
        See also: Names of the Philippines

        Fēilǜbīn - 菲律賓 / 菲律宾 (Mandarin Chinese), Felipines (Franco-Provençal), Filibīn or Firibīn - فلبين‎ (Arabic), Filipaina (Samoan), Filipiene (Limburgish), Filipiinid (Estonian), Filipiiniq (Võro), Filipijnen (Dutch), Fîlîpîn (Kurdish), Filipina (Acehnese, Banyumasan, Indonesian, Malay), Filipinai (Lithuanian), Filipinak (Basque), Filipinas (Aragonese, Central Bikolano, Chavacano, Filipino, Ilocano, Pampangan, Pangasinan, Portuguese, Spanish), Filīpinas (Latvian), Filipine (Romanian), Filipinen (Frisian), Filipines (Asturian, Catalan), Filipinet (Albanian), Filipini (Croatian, Slovene), Filīpīns - फ़िलीपीन्स (Hindi), gugdrfilipini (Lojban), Filipini - Филипини (Bulgarian, Macedonian, Serbian), Filipinim - פיליפינים‎ (Hebrew), Filipinler (Turkish), Filipinoj (Esperanto), Filipiny - Філіпіны (Belarusian), Filipíny (Czech, Slovak), Filipiny (Polish), na h-Eileanan Filipineach or na Filipìonan (Scots Gaelic variant), Filippiinit (Finnish), Filippin (Azeri), Filippinane (Norwegian - Nynorsk), Filippine (Italian), Filippinene (Norwegian - Bokmål), Filippinerna (Swedish), Filippinerne (Danish), Filippínes - Φιλιππίνες (Greek), il-Filippini (Maltese), Filippin - ฟิลิปปินส์ (Thai), Filippiny - Филиппины (Russian), Filippiny - Філіппіни (Ukrainian), Filippseyjar (Icelandic), Filippyne (Afrikaans), Filipsoyggjar (Faroese), Firipin - フィリピン (Japanese), Fülöp-szigetek (Hungarian), Hui-li̍p-pin (Min Nan), Filipain - ফিলিপাইন (Assamese, Bengali), Kaliṅgadvīpah - कलिङ्गद्वीपः (Sanskrit), Philipāīns - फिलिपाईन्स (Marathi), Philipina (Indonesian variant), Philippinae (Latin), Philippine (Alemannic), Philippinen (German, Luxembourgish), Philippines (French, Vietnamese), Phi Luật Tân (Vietnamese variant), Pilipinas (Cebuano, Filipino variant, Tagalog, Waray-Waray, Welsh), Pilipinaya - පිලිපීනය (Sinhala), Pilipinebi - ფილიპინები (Georgian), Pilipinepi - ფილიპინეფი (Mingrelian), Pilippinisi (Inuktitut), Pillipin / P'illip'in - 필리핀 (Korean), y Ffilipin (Welsh), பிலிப்பைன்ஸ்[romanization needed] (Tamil)

        Pitcairn Islands Eileanan Pheit a' Chàirn (Scots Gaelic), Ǧazur Bītkīrn - جزر بيتكيرن‎ (Arabic), il-Gżejjer Pitcairn (Maltese), Îles Pitcairn (French), Insulele Pitcairn (Romanian), Ishujt Pitcairn (Albanian), Islas Pitcairn (Spanish), Isole Pitcairn (Italian), Iyey Peetkern - איי פיטקרן‎ (Hebrew), Kepulauan Pitcairn (Indonesian), Kapuluang Pitcairn (Filipino/Tagalog), Muko Phitkhaen - หมู่เกาะพิตแคร์น (Thai), Nísoi Pítkairn - Νήσοι Πίτκαιρν (Greek), Ostrova Pitkern - Острова Питкэрн (Russian), Ostrovy Pitkern - Острови Піткерн (Ukrainian), Ostrva Pitkern - Острва Питкерн (Serbian), Pitakairan Dvīpasamūha - पिटकेर्न् द्वीपसमूह (Hindi, Sanskrit), Pitcairn (Estonian, Finnish, Polish variant, Portuguese), Pitcairn Adaları (Turkish), Pitcairn Islands (Danish), Pitcairn-szigetek (Hungarian), Pitcairneilanden (Dutch), Pitcairninseln (German), Pitcairnovy ostrovy (Czech), Pitcairnöarna (Swedish), Pitcairnøyene (Norwegian), Pítèkǎiēn qúndǎo - 皮特凯恩群岛 (Mandarin Chinese), Pitkeeon Jedo / P'itk'eŏn Chedo - 핏케언 제도 (Korean), Pitkerno salos (Lithuanian), Pitkernski Ostrovi - Питкернски Острови (Macedonian), Pitkeyan Divayin - පිට්කෙයාන් දිවයින් (Sinhala), Pitokean Shotō - ピトケアン諸島 (Japanese), Pitsuin Qikiqtat (Inuktitut), Quần đảo Pitcairn (Vietnamese), Wyspy Pitcairn (Polish), பிட்கன் தீவுகள்[romanization needed] (Tamil)
        Poland an Pholainn (Irish), a' Phòlainn (Scots Gaelic), Ba Lan (Vietnamese), Bōlán - 波蘭 / 波兰 (Mandarin Chinese), Būlandā - بولندا‎ (Arabic), Gwlad Pwyl (Welsh), Lehastan - Լեհաստան (Armenian), Lengyelország (Hungarian), Lenkija (Lithuanian), Poalen (Frisian), Poland (Malay), Polandia (Indonesian), Polaen - โปแลนด์ (Thai), Polaiṇḍ - पोलैण्ड् (Hindi, Sanskrit), Polanthaya - පෝලන්තය (Sinhala), Pole (Afrikaans), Polen (Danish, Dutch, German, Low Saxon, Norwegian, Swedish), Polija (Latvian), Polin - פולין‎ (Hebrew), Poljska (Bosnian, Croatian, Slovene), Poljska - Пољска (Serbian), Pólland (Faroese, Icelandic), Pollandeu / P'ollandŭ - 폴란드 (Korean), Pollando (Esperanto), Pologna (Romansh), Pologne (French), Poloneti - პოლონეთი (Georgian, Mingrelian), Polonia (Albanian, Basque, Italian, Latin, Romanian, Spanish), Polonía - Πολωνία (Greek), Polónia (Portuguese), Polònia (Catalan), Polônia (Brazilian Portuguese), Polonja (Maltese), Polonya (Filipino/Tagalog, Turkish), Polşa or Ləhistan (Azeri), Pol'šča - Польшча (Belarusian), Pol'ŝča - Польща (Ukrainian), Polsha - Полша (Bulgarian), Pol'sha - Польша (Russian), Polska (Lower Sorbian, Polish), Polska - Полска (Macedonian), Polsko (Czech), Poľsko (Slovak), Poola (Estonian, Võro), Pōrando - ポーランド (Japanese), Poyln - פּױלן‎ (Yiddish), Puola (Finnish), Puulanti (Inuktitut), போலந்து[romanization needed] (Tamil)
        Portugal a' Phortagail (Scots Gaelic), an Phortaingéil (Irish), Burtughāl - برتغال‎ (Arabic), Bồ Đào Nha (Vietnamese), Lusitania (Latin variant), Negara Portugis (Malay variant), Phiriṅgi - ফিরিঙ্গি (Bengali), Pertual (Mirandese), Protuket - โปรตุเกส (Thai), Poreutugal / P'orŭt'ugal - 포르투갈 (Korean), Portekiz (Turkish), Portiwgal (Welsh), Portogalía - Πορτογαλία (Greek), Portogallo (Italian), Portugal (Afrikaans, Basque, Catalan, Croatian, Danish, Dutch, Estonian, Faroese, Filipino/Tagalog, French, German, Indonesian, Low Saxon, Malay variant, Norwegian, Portuguese, Romansh, Scots Gaelic, Spanish, Swedish, Võro), Portugal - פורטוגל‎ (Hebrew), Portúgal (Icelandic), Portugal - Португал or Portugalija - Португалија (Macedonian, Serbian), Portugal - פּאָרטוגאַל‎ (Yiddish), Portugāle (Latvian), Portugali (Finnish), Portugalia (Albanian, Polish, Romanian), Portugália (Hungarian), Portugalia - Պորտուգալիա (Armenian), Portugalija (Lithuanian), Portugalio (Esperanto), Portugaliya - Португалия (Bulgarian, Russian), il-Portugall (Maltese), Portugallia (Latin), Portugalska (Lower Sorbian, Slovene), Portugalsko (Czech, Slovak), Portugis (former Indonesian), Porutogaru - ポルトガル (Japanese), Púguó - 葡國 / 葡国 (Mandarin Chinese variant), Purtagāl - पुर्तगाल् (Hindi, Sanskrit), Purutugali (Inuktitut), Portuhaliya - Португалія (Ukrainian), Prutugalaya - පෘතුගාලය (Sinhala), Pútáoyá - 葡萄牙 (Mandarin Chinese), போர்த்துக்கல்[romanization needed] (Tamil), Ureno (Swahili)
        Principality of Monaco Furstendömet Monaco (Swedish), Fürstentum Monaco (German), Fyrstedømmet Monaco (Danish, Norwegian), Imāra Munākū - إمارة موناكو‎ (Arabic), Kerajaan Monako (Indonesian), Kneževina Monako - Кнежевина Монако (Serbian), Kneževina Monako (Slovene), Knyazhestvo Monako - Княжество Монако (Bulgarian, Russian), Knyazivstvo Monako - Князівство Монако (Ukrainian), Księstwo Monako (Polish), Monacké kniežatstvo (Slovak), Monacké knížectví (Czech), Monacói Hercegség (Hungarian), Monaco (Polish variant), Monacon ruhtinaskunta (Finnish), Monaco Vürstiriik (Estonian), Mónàgē Dàgōngguó - 摩納哥大公國 / 摩纳哥大公国 (Mandarin Chinese), Monaka Princlando (Esperanto), Monako (Faroese, Polish variant), Monako - Монако (Macedonian), Nesichut Monako - נסיכות מונאקו‎ (Hebrew), Monako Gongguk / Monak'o Kongguk - 모나코 공국 (Korean), Monako kunigaikštystė (Lithuanian), Monāko Pradeśa - मोनाको प्रदेश (Hindi, Sanskrit), Monako Prensliği (Turkish), Monako Taikōkoku - モナコ大公国 (Japanese), Munaku (Inuktitut), Prigkipáto tu Monakó - Πριγκηπάτο του Μονακό (Greek), Principado de Mónaco (Spanish), Principado de Mônaco (Brazilian Portuguese), Principado do Mónaco (Portuguese), il-Prinċipat ta' Monaco (Maltese), Principata e Monakos (Albanian), Principato di Monaco (Italian), Principatul Monaco (Romanian), Principauté de Monaco (French), Prinsdom Monaco (Dutch), Prinsipado han Monaco (Waray-Waray), Prinsipado ng Mónako (Filipino/Tagalog), Prinsipæliti of Monako - ප්‍රින්සිපැලිටි ඔෆ් මොනාකෝ (Sinhala), Ratcharat Monako - ราชรัฐโมนาโก (Thai), Tywysogaeth Monaco (Welsh), Principatul Monaco (Romanian), Prionnsalachd Mhonaco (Scots Gaelic), மொனாக்கோ[romanization needed] (Tamil)
        Puerto Rico Bōduō Lígè - 波多黎各 (Mandarin Chinese), Borikén (Taíno), Burtū Rīkū - بورتو ريكو‎ (Arabic), Pu-éc-tô Ri-cô (Vietnamese), Puaito Riko - ปวยร์โตรีโก (Thai), Porto Rìceo (Scots Gaelic), Porto Rico (French, Indonesian alternate, Italian, Portuguese), Porto Riko (Turkish), Porṭo Rīko - पोर्टो रीको (Hindi, Sanskrit), Portoriko (Albanian, Croatian, Czech, Slovak, Slovene), Portoriko - Порторико (Macedonian, Serbian), Portoryko (Polish), Pouérto Ríko - Πουέρτο Ρίκο (Greek), Puereutoriko / P'uerŭt'orik'o - 푸에르토리코 (Korean), Puerto Rico (Danish, Dutch, Estonian, Filipino/Tagalog, Finnish, German, Hungarian, Maltese, Norwegian, Polish variant, Romanian, Spanish, Swedish), Puerto Rikas (Lithuanian), Puerto-Riko - Пуерто-Рико (Russian), Puerto Riko - Пуерто Рико (Bulgarian), Puerto Riko (Faroese, Indonesian), Puerto-Riko - פוארטו ריקו‎ (Hebrew), Puerutoriko - プエルトリコ (Japanese), Puerto Ryko - Пуерто-Рико (Ukrainian), Puirutu Riku (Inuktitut), Puwato Riko - පුවටෝ රිකෝ (Sinhala), Pwetoriko (Swahili), புவேர்ட்டோ ரிக்கோ[romanization needed] (Tamil)

        Languages
        On this Wikipedia the language links are at the top of the page across from the article title. Go to top.

        List of country names in various languages (Q–Z)

        • Afrikaans
        • پنجابی
        • ไทย
        • Türkçe
        • اردو
        Edit links
        • Article
        • Talk
          • Read

          • Read
          • Edit
          • View history
          From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia

          This article has multiple issues. Please help improve it or discuss these issues on the talk page. (Learn how and when to remove these template messages)
          This article contains a list that has not been sorted. Some lists are alphabetized incorrectly. See Help:Sorting for more information. Please improve this article if you can. (January 2023)
          This article does not cite any sources. Please help improve this article by adding citations to reliable sources. Unsourced material may be challenged and removed.
          Find sources: "List of country names in various languages" Q–Z – news · newspapers · books · scholar · JSTOR           (March 2018) (Learn how and when to remove this template message)
          (Learn how and when to remove this template message)

          Most countries of the world have different names in different languages. Some countries have also undergone name changes for political or other reasons. Countries are listed alphabetically by their most common name in English. Each English name is followed by its most common equivalents in other languages, listed in English alphabetical order (ignoring accents) by name and by language. Historical and/or alternative versions, where included, are noted as such. Foreign names that are the same as their English equivalents are also listed. See also: List of alternative country names

          Please format entries as follows: for languages written in the Latin alphabet, write "Name (language)", for example, "Afeganistão (Portuguese)", and add it to the list according to English rules of alphabetical order. For languages written in other writing systems, write "Romanization - native script (language)", for example "Argentine - אַרגענטינע‎ (Yiddish)", and alphabetize it in the list by the Romanized form.

          Due to its size, this list has been split into four parts:

          • List of country names in various languages (A–C)
          • List of country names in various languages (D–I)
          • List of country names in various languages (J–P)
          • List of country names in various languages (Q–Z)
          List: 
          • Q
          • R
          • S
          • T
          • U
          • V
          • W
          • X
          • Y
          • Z

          • See also
          • External links
          Q
          English name Names in different languages

          Sierra Leone Araone, Te (Maori), Sàilā Lìáng - 塞拉利昂 (Mandarin Chinese), Serra Leoa (Portuguese), Shīzǐshān - 獅子山 (Chinese variant), Shiyera Lion - সিয়েরা লিওন (Bengali), Si-ê-ra Lê-ôn (Vietnamese), Siarra Leòmhann (Scots Gaelic), Siera Leone (Albanian), Siera Leone - Сиера Леоне (Bulgarian, Macedonian), Siera Leone - סיירה לאונה‎ (Hebrew), Siera Leonė (Lithuanian), Siéra Leóne - Σιέρα Λεόνε (Greek), Siera-Leono (Esperanto), Siera Lion - เซียร์ราลีโอน (Thai), Sierā Liyon - सिएरा लियोन् (Hindi, Sanskrit), Sierarion - 시에라리온 (Korean), Sierra Leöane (Frisian), Sierra Leona (Spanish), Sierra Leone (Afrikaans, Czech, Danish, Dutch, Estonian, Faroese, Finnish, French, German, Hungarian, Indonesian, Italian, Malay, Maltese, Norwegian, Polish, Romanian, Slovak, Slovene, Swedish, Turkish), Sijera Leone - Сијера Леоне (Serbian), Shierareone - シエラレオネ (Japanese), Siirra Liuni (Inuktitut), Siiraaliyoon (Somali), Sīrāliyūn - سيراليون‎ (Arabic), Siyera Liyon - සියෙරා ලියොන් (Sinhala), Sjerraleone (Latvian), Syerra-Leone - Сьерра-Леоне (Russian), S'yerra-Leone - Сьєрра-Леоне (Ukrainian), சியரா லியோன்[romanization needed] (Tamil), سیرا لیون[romanization needed] (Urdu)
          Singapore
          Main article: Names of Singapore
          Cangkapu - စင်္ကာပူ (Burmese), Cingapura (Brazilian Portuguese variant), Ciṅkappūr - சிங்கப்பூர் (Tamil), Hingapoa (Maori), Shingapōru - シンガポール (Japanese), Shingapur - সিঙ্গাপুর (Bengali), Sigkapúri - Σιγκαπούρη (Greek), Siṃhapura - सिंहपुर (Sanskrit), Singaapur - सिन्गापुर (Hindi), Singabuur (Somali), Singapoer (Afrikaans), Singapor (Faroese, Maltese), Singapore (Danish, Dutch, Finnish, Frisian, Italian, Maltese variant, Norwegian, Romanian, Swedish), Singapour (French), Singappuruwa - සිංගප්පූරුව (Sinhala), Singapur (Albanian, Czech, Estonian, German, Polish, Slovene, Spanish, Turkish, Võro), Singapur - Сингапур (Bulgarian, Macedonian, Russian, Serbian), Singapur - Сінгапур (Ukrainian), Singapur - סינגפור‎ (Hebrew), Singapura (Indonesian, Malay, Portuguese, Tagalog/Filipino), Singapūra (Latvian), Singapūras (Lithuanian), Singapuro (Esperanto), Singapuuri (Inuktitut), Singeapòr (Scots Gaelic), Singgaporeu / Singgap'orŭ - 싱가포르 (Korean), Singhāfūrah - سنغافورة‎ (Arabic), Singkhapo - สิงคโปร์ (Thai), Szingapúr (Hungarian), Xin-ga-po (Vietnamese), Xīnjiāpō - 新加坡 or Xīngjiāpō - 星加坡 (Mandarin Chinese), سنگاپور[romanization needed] (Urdu)

          Solomon Islands Eileanan Sholaimh (Scots Gaelic), Ǧazur Sulaymān - جزائرِ سلیمان‎ (Arabic), il-Gżejjer Solomon (Maltese), Îles Salomon (French), Ilhas Salomão (Portuguese), Insulele Solomon (Romanian), Ishujt Solomon (Albanian), Islas Salomón (Spanish), Isole Salomone (Italian), Iyey Shlomo - איי שלמה‎ (Hebrew), Kepulauan Solomon (Indonesian, Malay), Muko Solomon - หมู่เกาะโซโลมอ (Thai), Nísoi Solomónta - Νήσοι Σολομώντα (Greek), Saalomini Saarõq (Võro), Saalomoni Saared (Estonian), Salamon-szigetek (Hungarian), Šalamounovy ostrovy (Czech), Šalamúnove ostrovy (Slovak), Saliamono Salos (Lithuanian), Salomonen (German), Salomonöarna (Swedish), Salomonøerne (Danish), Salomonoj (Esperanto), Salomonovi otoki (Slovene), Salomonøyene (Norwegian), Salomonsaaret (Finnish), Salomonseilanden (Dutch), Salomonseilannen (Frisian), Solaman Dupath - සොලමන් දූපත් (Sinhala), Sollomon Jedo / Sollomon Chedo - 솔로몬 제도 (Korean), Soloman Dvīpa - सोलोमन् द्वीप (Hindi, Sanskrit), Solomon Adaları (Turkish), Solomoni - Соломони or Solomonski Ostrovi - Соломонски Острови (Macedonian), Solomonova ostrva - Соломонова острва (Serbian), Solomonovi ostrovi - Соломонови острови (Bulgarian, Macedonian variant), Solomonovy Ostrova - Соломоновы Острова (Russian), Solomonovi Ostrovy - Соломонові Острови (Ukrainian), Soromon Shotō - ソロモン諸島 (Japanese), Sulaymaan Deeppunjo - সুলায়মান দ্বীপপুঞ্জ (Bengali), Sulumun Qikiqtat (Inuktitut), Suǒluómén qúndǎo - 索羅門群島 or 所羅門群島 (Chinese), Wyspy Salomona (Polish), Xô-lô-môn (Vietnamese), Zālamana Salas (Latvian), சாலமன் தீவுகள்[romanization needed] (Tamil)
          Somalia aṣ-Ṣūmāl - الصومال‎ (Arabic), Hūmārie (Maori), is-Somalja (Maltese), Somali - Сомали (Russian), Somali - Сомалі (Ukrainian), Somaalia (Estonian, Võro), Somaalje (Frisian), Somàilia (Scots Gaelic), Somali (Turkish), Somalia (Albanian, Danish, Faroese, Finnish, German, Indonesian, Italian, Malay, Norwegian, Polish, Romanian, Spanish, Swedish), Somália (Portuguese), Somalía - Σομαλία (Greek), Somalia - โซมาเลีย (Thai), Somalie (French), Somalië (Afrikaans, Dutch), Somālija (Latvian), Somalija - Сомалија (Macedonian, Serbian), Somalija (Slovene), Somalio (Esperanto), Somalis (Lithuanian), Somaliya - Сомалия (Bulgarian), Somaliya - סומליה‎ (Hebrew), Somāliyā - सोमालिया (Hindi, Sanskrit), Somaliyawa - සෝමාලියාව (Sinhala), Somallia - 소말리아 (Korean), Somálsko (Czech, Slovak), Somaria - ソマリア (Japanese), Soomaaliya (Somali), Sumalia (Inuktitut), Suǒmǎlǐ - 索馬里 or Suǒmǎlìyà - 索馬利亞 (Chinese), Szomália (Hungarian), Xô-ma-li (Vietnamese), சோமாலியா[romanization needed] (Tamil), صومالیہ[romanization needed] (Urdu), সোমালিয়া[romanization needed] (Bengali)

          South Africa தென் ஆப்ரிக்கா[romanization needed] (Tamil), Aefrika Tai - แอฟริกาใต้ (Thai), Afraga a Deas (Scots Gaelic), Africa Australis (Latin), Africa dal Sid (Romansh), Africa de Sud (Romanian), África do Sul (Portuguese), Afrika del Sur (Tagalog), Afrika Jugore (Albanian variant), Afrika Kusini (Swahili), Afrika Selatan (Indonesian, Malay), Afrika Seulatan (Acehnese), Afrique du Sud (French), Afryka Południowa (Polish), Āwherika ki te Tonga (Maori), Cənubi Afrika (Azeri), Däbub Ăfrika -           South Georgia and South Sandwich Islands Dakṣiṇa Jŏrjiyā evam Dakṣiṇa Saiṇḍvic Dvīpa Samūha - दक्षिण जॉर्जिया एवं दक्षिण सैंडविच् द्वीप समूह (Hindi, Sanskrit), Déli-Georgia és Déli-Sandwich-szigetek (Hungarian), Dhakunu Jorjiyawa saha Dhakunu Sændwich Dupath - දකුණු ජෝර්ජියාව සහ දකුණු සැන්ඩ්විච් දූපත් (Sinhala), Dienviddžordžija un Dienvidsendviču salas (Latvian), Etelä-Georgia ja Eteläiset Sandwichsaaret (Finnish), Georgia de Sud și Insulele Sandwich de Sud (Romanian), Georgia del Sud e Isole Sandwich Australi (Italian), Georgia Południowa i Sandwich Południowy (Polish), Géorgie du Sud-et-les îles Sandwich du Sud (French), Gjeorgjia Jugore dhe Ishujt Jugorë Sanduiç (Albanian), Ǧorjīyā al-Ǧanūbiyāt wa Ǧazur Sandwitš al-Ǧanūbiyāt - جورجيا الجنوبية وجزر ساندويتش الجنوبية‎ (Arabic), Güney Georgia ve Güney Sandwich Adaları (Turkish), Ilhas Geórgia do Sul e Sandwich do Sul (Portuguese), Islas Georgias del Sur y Sandwich del Sur (Spanish), Iyey Jorjiya Ha'Dromiyim ve'Iyey Sendvitsh Ha'Dromoyim - איי ג'ורג'יה הדרומיים ואיי סנדוויץ' הדרומיים‎ (Hebrew), Jižní Georgie a Jižní Sandvichovy ostrovy (Czech), Južna Džordžija i Južna Sendvička ostrva - Јужна Џорџија и Јужна Сендвичка острва (Serbian), Južna Džordžija i Južni Sendvički ostrovi - Јужна Џорџија и Јужни Сендвички Острови (Macedonian), Kepulauan Georgia Selatan dan Sandwich Selatan (Indonesian, Malay), Ko Saoth Chochia lae Muko Saoth Saenwit - เกาะเซาท์จอร์เจียและหมู่เกาะเซาท์แซนด์วิช (Thai), Lõuna-Georgia ja Lõuna-Sandwichi saared (Estonian), Minami Jōjia oyobi Minami Sandowicchi Shotō - 南ジョージアおよび南サンドウィッチ諸島 (Japanese), Nam Georgia và Quần đảo Nam Sandwich (Vietnamese), Nán Qiáozhìyà yǔ Nán Sānmíngzhì qúndǎo - 南乔治亚和南桑德韦奇群岛 / 南喬治亞與南三明治群島 (Mandarin Chinese), Nigani Jiuujialu Nigani Santuisi Qikiqtat (Inuktitut), Nísoi Nótia Georgía kai Nóties Sántouits - Νήσοι Νότια Γεωργία και Νότιες Σάντουιτς (Greek), Pietų Džordžijos ir Pietų Sandvičo salos (Lithuanian), Pivdenna Dzhordzhiya ta Pivdenni Sandvichevi ostrovy - Південна Джорджія та Південні Сандвічеві острови (Ukrainian), Seòirsea a Deas is na h-Eileanan Sandwich a Deas (Scots Gaelic), Sauseu Jojia Sauseu Saendeuwichi Jedo / Sausŭ Chojia Sausŭ Saendŭwich'i Chedo - 사우스조지아 사우스샌드위치 제도 (Korean), Sør-Georgia og Sør-Sandwichøyene (Norwegian), South Georgia og South Sandwich Islands (Danish), Südgeorgien und Südliche Sandwichinseln (German), Sydgeorgien och Sydsandwichöarna (Swedish), Yuzhna Dzhordzhiya i Yuzhni Sandvichevi ostrovi - Южна Джорджия и Южни Сандвичеви острови (Bulgarian), Yuzhnaja Georgija i Yuzhnye Sandvičevy Ostrova - Южная Георгия и Южные Сандвичевы Острова (Russian), Zuid-Georgië en de Zuidelijke Sandwicheilanden (Dutch), தெற்கு ஜார்ஜியாவும் தெற்கு சாண்ட்விச் தீவுகளும்[romanization needed] (Tamil), جزائرِ جنوبی جارجیا و جنوبی سینڈوچ[romanization needed] (Urdu)
          South Korea Coiria a Deas (Scots Gaelic), Corea del Sud (Italian), Corea del Sur (Spanish), Coreea de Sud (Romanian), Corée du Sud (French), Coreia do Sul (Portuguese), Coréia do Sul (Brazilian Portuguese), Corea Meridionalis (Latin), Dakṣiṇa Koriyā - दक्षिण कोरिया (Hindi, Sanskrit), De Corea (Welsh), Dél-Korea (Hungarian), Dhakunu Koriyava - දකුණු කොරියාව (Sinhala), Dienvidkoreja (Latvian), Drom Korea - דרום קוריאה‎ (Hebrew), Etelä-Korea (Finnish), Kūriyā al-Ǧanūbīyâ - كوريا الجنوبية‎ (Arabic), Güney Kore (Turkish), Hanguk / Han'guk - 한국 (formally Daehan Minguk / Taehan Min'guk - 대한민국) (Korean - South Korea), Hánguó - 韩国 (formally Dàhánmínguó - 大韓民国 or Náncháoxiǎn - 南朝鲜) (Mandarin Chinese), Hàn Quốc (Vietnamese), Nam Hàn (Vietnamese variant), Haravayin Koria - Հարավային Կորեա (Armenian), il-Korea t'Isfel (Maltese), Jižní Korea (Czech), Južná Kórea (Slovak), Južna Koreja (Croatian), Južna Koreja (Upper Sorbian), Južna Koreja - Јужна Кореја (Macedonian, Serbian), Kankoku - 韓国 (formally Daikan Minkoku - 大韓民国 (Japanese), Kaoli Tai - เกาหลีใต้ (Thai) Korea Południowa (Polish), Korea Selatan (Indonesian, Malay), Koreja e Jugut (Albanian), Korsel (Indonesian variant), Lõuna-Korea (Estonian), Namjosŏn - 남조선 (Korean - North Korea), Nigani Kuria (Inuktitut), Notia Korea - Νότια Κορέα (Greek), Pietų Korėja (Lithuanian), Pivdenna Koreya - Південна Корея (Ukrainian), Pódpołdnjowa Koreja (Lower Sorbian), Sør-Korea (Norwegian), Südkorea (German), Suðurkorea (Faroese), Sydkorea (Danish, Swedish), Timog Korea (Filipino/Tagalog), Umnud Solongos - Өмнөд Солонгос (Mongolian), Yuzhna Koreya - Южна Корея (Bulgarian), Yuzhnaya Koreya - Ю́жная Коре́я (Russian), Yvykorea (Guaraní), Zuid-Korea (Dutch), Zuud-Korea (Limburgish), தென்கொரியா[romanization needed] (Tamil), جنوبی کوریا[romanization needed] (Urdu)

          T
          English name Names in different languages
          Taiwan (officially Republic of China) Đài Loan (Vietnamese), Dài-uăng (Min Dong), it-Tajwan (Maltese), Taidh-Bhàn (Scots Gaelic), Tailani (Samoan), Tâi-oân (Min Nan), Taiuã (Portuguese variant), Taivan (Inuktitut), Taïván - Ταϊβάν (Greek), Tāivān - ताइवान (Hindi, Sanskrit), Taivāna (Latvian), Taivanas (Lithuanian), Taiwan (Catalan, Danish, Dutch, Estonian, Finnish, German, Indonesian, Italian, Malay, Norwegian, Portuguese, Romanian, Swedish, Welsh, West Frisian), Taiwan - 台湾 (formally Chūka Minkoku - 中華民国 (Japanese), Taiwan / T'aiwan - 타이완 or Daeman / Taeman - 대만(臺灣) (Korean), Taiwán (Galician, Spanish), Taïwan (French), Táiwān - 臺灣 / 台湾 (Chinese), Taiwan - ไต้หวัน (Thai), Tajvan (Albanian, Hungarian, Slovene), Tajvan - Тајван (Macedonian, Serbian), Tajvano (Esperanto), Tajwan (Polish), Tayiwan - තායිවාන් (Sinhala), Tayvan - Тайвань (Bulgarian, Russian, Ukrainian), Taywan - טאיוואן‎ or טיוואן‎ (Hebrew), Tayvan (Turkish), Taywan (Filipino/Tagalog), Tāywān - تايوان‎ (Arabic), Tchaj-wan (Czech), தைவான்[romanization needed] (Tamil)

          United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland al-Mamlaka l-Muttaḥida li-Birīṭāniyā l-Uẓmā wa-Ayirlandā š-Šamāliyya - المملكة المتحدة لبريطانيا العظمى وأيرلندا الشمالية‎ (Arabic), an Rìoghachd Aonaichte Bhreatainn Mhòr agus Èireann a Tuath (Scots Gaelic), Böyük Britaniya və Şimali İrlandiya Birləşmiş Krallığı (Azeri), Bṛhad Briṭen aur Uttarī Āyarlaiṇḍ kā Yūnāīṭeḍ Kiṅgḍam - बृहद् ब्रिटेन और उत्तरी आयरलैण्ड का यूनाईटेड किंगडम (Hindi), Britainia Handiko eta Ipar Irlandako Erresuma Batua (Basque), Büyük Britanya ve Kuzey İrlanda Birleşik Krallığı (Turkish), Dà Bùlièdiān jí Běi Ài'ěrlán Liánhéwángguó - 大不列顛及北愛爾蘭聯合王國 (Chinese), Det forente kongerike Storbritannia og Nord-Irland (Norwegian), Didi Britanetisa da Chrdiloet Irlandiis Gaertianebuli Samepo - დიდი ბრიტანეთისა და ჩრდილოეთ ირლანდიის გაერთიანებული სამეფო (Georgian), Didi Britanetish do Oorue Irlandiash Goartoianapili Omape - დიდი ბრიტანეთიშ დო ოორუე ირლანდიაშ გოართოიანაფილი ომაფე (Mingrelian), Feriene Keninkryk fan Grut-Brittanje en Noard Ierlân (West Frisian), Förenade konungariket Storbritannien och Nordirland (Swedish), (Det) Forenede Kongerige Storbritannien og Nordirland (Danish), Geānlǣhte Cynerīce Grēatre Brytene and Norþīrlandes (Anglo-Saxon), Geureiteu Beuriteun Buk Aillaendeu Yeonhap Wangguk / Kŭreit'ŭ Pŭrit'ŭn Puk Aillaendŭ Yŏnhap Wangguk - 그레이트 브리튼 북아일랜드 연합왕국 (Korean), Gurēto Buriten oyobi Kita Airurando Rengō Ōkoku - グレートブリテン及び北アイルランド連合王国 (Japanese), Ha'Mamlakha Ha'Meukhedet shel Britaniya Ha'Gdolah ve'Tsfon Irland - הממלכה המאוחדת של בריטניה הגדולה וצפון אירלנד‎ (Hebrew), Hið sameinaða konungsdæmi Stóra-Bretland og Norður-Írland (Icelandic), Inoméno Vasílio tis Megális Vretannías kai Voríou Irlandías - Ηνωμένο Βασίλειο της Μεγάλης Βρεταννίας και Βορείου Ιρλανδίας (Greek), ir-Renju Unit tal-Gran Brittanja u l-Irlanda ta' Fuq (Maltese), Ison-Britannian ja Pohjois-Irlannin yhdistynyt kuningaskunta (Finnish), Jungtinė Didžiosios Britanijos ir Šiaurės Airijos Karalystė (Lithuanian), Lielbritānijas un Ziemeļīrijas Apvienotā Karaliste (Latvian), Maha Britanya Ha Uthuru Ayarlantha Eksath Rajadhaniya - මහා බ්රිතාන්ය හා උතුරු අයර්ලන්ත එක්සත් රාජධානිය (Sinhala), Mahābritānīyasya Uttarī Āyalryāṇdasya ca Samyuktādhirājyam - महाब्रिटानीयस्य उत्तरी आयर्ल्याण्डस्य च संयुक्ताधिराज्यम् (Sanskrit), Mbretëria e Bashkuar e Britanisë së Madhe dhe Irlandës Veriore (Albanian), Medzn Bridaniayi yev Hiusisayin Irlandayi Miatsial Takavorutiun - Մեծ Բրիտանիայի և Հյուսիսային Իռլանդիայի Միացյալ Թագավորություն (Armenian), Moha Briten o Uttor Ayarlender Juktorajjo - মহা ব্রিটেন ও উত্তর আয়ারল্যান্ডের যুক্তরাজ্য (Bengali), Nagkakaisang Kaharian ng Gran Britanya at Hilagang Irlanda (Filipino/Tagalog), Nagy-Britannia és Észak-Írország Egyesült Királysága (Hungarian), Obedineno kralstvo Velikobritaniya i Severna Irlandiya - Обединено кралство Великобритания и Северна Ирландия (Bulgarian), Obedineto Kralstvo na Velika Britanija i Severna Irska - Обединето Кралство на Велика Британија и Северна Ирска (Macedonian), Perserikatan Kerajaan Britania Raya dan Irlandia Utara (Indonesian), Regatul Unit al Marii Britanii și Irlandei de Nord (Romanian), Reginavel unì da la Gronda Britannia ed Irlanda dal Nord (Romansh), Regne Unit de la Gran Bretanya i Irlanda del Nord (Catalan), Regno Unito di Gran Bretagna e Irlanda del Nord (Italian), Regnum Unitum Magnae Britanniae et Hiberniae Septentrionalis (Latin), Reino Unido da Grã-Bretanha e Irlanda do Norte (Portuguese), Reino Unido de la Gran Bretaña e Irlanda del Norte (Spanish), Ríocht Aontaithe na Breataine Móire agus Thuaisceart Éireann (Irish), Royaume-Uni de Grande-Bretagne et d'Irlande du Nord (French), an Rywvaneth Unys a Vreten Veur hag Iwerdhon Gledh (Cornish), Saharatcha-anachak Kret Briten Lae Nothoen Ailaen - สหราชอาณาจักรเกรตบริเตนและนอร์เทิร์นไอร์แลนด์ (Thai), Sameinda kongaríki Stórabretland og Írland (Faroese), Soyedinyonnoye Korolevstvo Velikobritanii i Severnoy Irlandii - Соединённое Королевство Великобритании и Северной Ирландии (Russian), Spojené království Velké Británie a Severního Irska (Czech), Spojené kráľovstvo Veľkej Británie a Severného Írska (Slovak), Spolučene Korolivstvo Velykoï Brytaniï ta Pivničnoï Irlandiï - Сполучене Королівство Великої Британії та Північної Ірландії (Ukrainian), Suurbritannia ja Põhja-Iiri Ühendkuningriik (Estonian), Teyrnas Unedig Prydain Fawr a Gogledd Iwerddon (Welsh), Ujedinjeno Kraljevstvo Velike Britanije i Severne Irske - Ујдињено Краљевство Велике Британије и Северне Ирске (Serbian), Ulıbrïtanïya men Soltüstik Ïrlandïyanıñ Birikken Korol’digi - Ұлыбритания мен Солтүстік Ирландияның Біріккен Корольдігі (Kazakh), Unitit Kinrick o Great Breetain an Northern Ireland (Scots/Lallans), Vereinigtes Königreich Großbritannien und Nordirland (German), Verenigde Koninkryk van Groot-Brittanje en Noord-Ierland (Afrikaans), Verenigd Koninkrijk van Groot-Brittanië en Noord-Ierland (Dutch), Vương quốc Liên hiệp Anh và Bắc Ireland (Vietnamese), Združeno kraljestvo Velika Britanije in Severne Irske (Slovene), Zjadnośone kralostwo Wjelikeje Britiskeje a Pódpołnocneje Irskeje (Lower Sorbian), Zjednoćene kralestwo Wulkeje Britaniskeje a Sewjerneje Irskeje (Upper Sorbian), Zjednoczone Królestwo Wielkiej Brytanii i Irlandii Północnej (Polish), கிரேட் பிரிட்டனும்வ வடக்கு அயர்லாந்தும்[romanization needed] (Tamil), برطانیہ[romanization needed] (Urdu)
          United States of America (US) al-Wilāyāt al-Muttaḥida(t) al-Amrīkiyya - الولايات المتحدة الأمريكية‎ (Arabic), Ameeriga Ütisriigiq (Võro), Ameerika Ühendriigid (Estonian), ʻAmelika Hui Pū ʻla (Hawaiian), Amerika Birleşik Devletleri (ABD) (Turkish), Amerika Birləşmiş Ştatları (Azeri), Amerika Gasshūkoku - アメリカ合衆国 (Japanese), Amerika Hapjungguk / Amerik'a Hapchungguk - 아메리카 합중국 (Korean), Amerïka Qurama Ştattarı - Америка Құрама Штаттары (Kazakh), Amerika Serikat (AS) (Indonesian)[b], Amerikai Egyesült Államok (AEÁ) (Hungarian), Amerikan yhdysvallat (Finnish), Amerikas Forenede Stater (USA) (Danish), Amerikas Förenta Stater (USA) (Swedish), Amerikas forente stater (USA) (Norwegian), Amerikash Akoartapili Shtatepi - ამერიკაშ აკოართაფილი შტატეფი (Mingrelian), Amerikas Savienotās Valstis (Latvian), Amerika Syarikat (AS) (Malay), Æmerika Eksath Janapadhaya - ඇමෙරිකා එක්සත් ජනපදය, short form: Æmerikawa - ඇමෙරිකාව (Sinhala), Amerikāyāh Samyuktārājyāni - अमेरिकायाः संयुक्तराज्यानि (Sanskrit), Ameriketako Estatu Batuak (Basque), Amerikian Miadzial Nahangner - Ամերիկայի Միացյալ Նահանգներ (Armenian), Amerikis Sheertebuli Shtatebi - ამერიკის შეერთებული შტატები (Georgian), Artsot Ha'Brit shel Amerika - ארצות הברית של אמריקה‎ (Hebrew), Àwọn Ìpínlẹ̀ Aparapọ̀ ilẹ̀ Amẹ́ríkà (Yorùbá), Bandaríki Norður-Ameríku (Icelandic), Civitates Americae Unitae (Latin), Estados Unidos da América (EUA) (Portuguese), Estados Unidos de América (EE. UU.) (Spanish), Estats Units d'Amèrica del Nord (Catalan), États-Unis d'Amérique (ÉUA) (French), Feriene Steaten fan Amearika (West Frisian), Hợp chúng quốc Hoa Kỳ (Vietnamese), l-Istati Uniti tal-Amerka (Maltese), Inoménes Politíes tis Amerikís (IPA) - Ηνωμένες Πολιτείες της Αμερικής (ΗΠΑ) (Greek), Iunaite Sitete o Amerika (Samoan), Jungtinės Amerijos Valstijos (JAV) (Lithuanian), Markin Juktorashtro - মার্কিন যুক্তরাষ্ট্র (Bengali), Měilìjiān hézhòngguó - 美利坚合众国 / 美利堅合眾國 or Yàměilìjiān hézhòngguó - 亞美利堅合眾國 (Chinese), mergu'e / .iunaited.steits. (Lojban), Mga Nagkakaisang Estado ng Amerika (Tagalog), Muungano wa Madola ya Amerika (Swahili), na Stàitean Aonaichte Aimeireaga (Scots Gaelic), Saedineni amerikanski shtati (SASht) - Съединени американски щати (САЩ) (Bulgarian), Saharat Amerika - สหรัฐอเมริกา (Thai), Sãyukta Rājya Amerīkā - संयुक्त राज्य अमेरीका (Hindi), Shtetet e Bashkuara të Amerikës (ShBA) (Albanian), Sjedinjene Američke Države (SAD) (Bosnian, Croatian), Sjedinjene Američke Države (SAD) - Сједињене Америчке Државе (САД) (Serbian), Soedineti Amerikanski Državi (SAD) - Соединети Американски Држави (САД) (Macedonian), Soyedinyonnyye Shtaty Ameriki (SShA) - Соединённые Штаты Америки (США) (Russian), Spojené státy americké (SSA) (Czech), Spojené štáty americké (Slovak), Spolučeni Štaty Ameryky (SŠA) - Сполучені Штати Америки (США) (Ukrainian), Stadis Unids da l'America (Romansh), Stáit Aontaithe Mheiriceá (SAM) (Irish), Stany Zjednoczone Ameryki (USA) (Polish), Statele Unite ale Americii (SUA) (Romanian), Stati Uniti d'America (USA) (Italian), Tetã peteĩ reko Amérikagua (Guaraní), Unol Daleithiau America (Welsh), Unuiĝintaj Ŝtatoj de Ameriko (Esperanto), Vereinigte Staaten von Amerika (USA) (German), Verenigde State van Amerika (Afrikaans), Verenigde Staten van Amerika (VS) (Dutch), Amerikan Pranthaungcu - အမေရိကန်ပြည်ထောင်စု (Burmese), Wááshindoon Bikéyah Ałhidadiidzooígíí (Navajo), Združene države Amerike (Slovene), Zjadnośone staty Ameriki (Lower Sorbian), அமெரிக்கா[romanization needed] (Tamil), ریاست ہائے متحدہ امریکا[romanization needed] (Urdu)
          United States Virgin Islands ABD Virjin Adaları (Turkish), Američka Devičanska ostrva - Америчка Девичанска острва (Serbian), Americké Panenské ostrovy (Czech), Amerikaanse Maagdeneilanden (Dutch), Amerikai Virgin-szigetek (Hungarian), Amerikanikés Parthénoi Nísoi - Αμερικανικές Παρθένοι Νήσοι (Greek), Amerikanische Jungferninseln (German), Amerikanska Jungfruöarna (Swedish), Amerikanske Jomfruøer (Danish), Amerikanske Jomfruøyer (Norwegian), Amerikanski Devstveni Ostrovi - Американски Девствени Острови (Macedonian), Amerikāņu Virdžīnas (Latvian), Amerika-ryō Vājin Shotō - アメリカ領ヴァージン諸島 (Japanese), Amerykans'ki Virgins'ki ostrovy - Американські Віргінські острови (Ukrainian), Amirika Sutatisu Vaajin Qikiqtat (Inuktitut), Amerikonsku Jomfrúoyggjar (Faroese), Eileanan na Maighdinn aig na Stàitean Aonaichte (Scots Gaelic), Eksath Janapadha Varjin Divayin - එක්සත් ජනපද වර්ජින් දිවයින් (Sinhala), Ǧazur al-Aḏrā al-Amrīkyā - جزر العذراء الأمريكية‎ (Arabic), il-Gżejjer Verġni Amerikani (Maltese), Îles Vierges des États-Unis (French), Ilhas Virgens Americanas (Portuguese), Insulele Virgine Americane (Romanian), Ishujt Virgjine (Albanian), Islas Vírgenes de los Estados Unidos (Spanish), Isole Vergini Americane (Italian), Iyey Ha'Betulah shel Artsot Ha'Brit - איי הבתולה של ארצות הברית‎ (Hebrew), Kapuluang Birhen ng Estados Unidos (Filipino/Tagalog), Kepulauan Virgin Amerika (Indonesian, Malay), Měishǔ chùnǚ dǎo - 美属处女岛 (Chinese), Mergelių salos (Lithuanian), Migungnyeong Beojin Jedo / Migungnyŏng Pŏjin Chedo - 미국령 버진 제도 (Korean), Muko Woechin Khong Saharat - หมู่เกาะเวอร์จินของสหรัฐ (Thai), Quần đảo Virgin thuộc Mỹ (Vietnamese), Sãyukt Rājya Varjin Dvīpasanūha - संयुक्त राज्य वर्जिन् द्वीपसमूह (Hindi, Sanskrit), USA Neitsisaared (Estonian), Virginskiye Ostrova SShA - Виргинские Острова США (Russian), Wyspy Dziewicze Stanów Zjednoczonych (Polish), Yhdysvaltain Neitsytsaaret (Finnish), அமெரிக்காவில் வெர்ஜின் தீவுகள்[romanization needed] (Tamil), ریاستہائے متحدہ جزائرِ ورجن[romanization needed] (Urdu)
          Uruguay l-Urugwaj (Maltese), U-ru-goay (Vietnamese), Uruguai (Inuktitut, Portuguese, Romansh), Uruguai - ウルグアイ (Japanese), Uruguái - Ουρουγουάη (Greek), Uruguaidh (Scots Gaelic), Uruguái (Guaraní), Uruguaj (Albanian), Uruguay (Afrikaans, Czech, Danish, Dutch, Estonian, Finnish, French, German, Hungarian, Indonesian, Italian, Malay, Norwegian, Romanian, Slovak, Spanish, Swedish, Turkish), Urûguay (West Frisian), Uruguay - אורוגוואי‎ (Hebrew), Ūrūḡuwāy - أوروغواي‎ (Arabic), Uruguway - උරුගුවේ (Sinhala), Urugvaj - Уругвај (Macedonian, Serbian), Urugvaj (Slovene), Urugvaja (Latvian), Urugvajo (Esperanto), Urugvajus (Lithuanian), Urugvay - Уругвай (Bulgarian, Russian, Ukrainian), Urugve - उरुग्वे (Hindi, Sanskrit), Urugwai - 우루과이 (Korean), Urugwaj (Polish), Urukwai - อุรุกวัย (Thai), Wūlāguī - 烏拉圭 (Chinese), உருகுவே[romanization needed] (Tamil), یوروگوئے[romanization needed] (Urdu)
          Uzbekistan l-Użbekistan (Maltese), Oesbekistan (Afrikaans), Oezbekistan (Dutch), Ouzbékistan (French), Ouzbekistán - Ουζμπεκιστάν (Greek), Özbekistan (Turkish), Özbəkistan (Azeri), U-dơ-bê-ki-xtan (Vietnamese), Ujabekisthāna - उजबेकिस्थान (Sanskrit), Ujeubekiseutan / Ujŭbek'isŭt'an - 우즈베키스탄 (Korean), Usbagastàn (Scots Gaelic), Usbecia (Latin), Usbekistan (Danish, Estonian, Faroese, German, Indonesian variant, Norwegian, Võro), Usbekistanaya - උස්බෙකිස්තානය (Sinhala), Usbekisthan - อุซเบกิสถาน (Thai), Usbequistão (Portuguese variant), Usupikisutan (Inuktitut), Üzbäkstan (Tatar), Ūzbakistān - أوزبكستان‎ (Arabic), Üzbegisztán (Hungarian), Uzbekio (Esperanto), Uzbekistan (Albanian, Croatian, Catalan, Danish variant, Finnish, Indonesian, Italian, Malay, Polish, Romanian, Slovak, Slovene, Swedish), Uzbekistán (Czech, Spanish), Uzbekistan - Узбекистан (Bulgarian, Macedonian, Russian, Serbian), Uzbekistan - אוזבקיסטן‎ (Hebrew), Uzbekistān - उज़्बेकिस्तान (Hindi), Uzbekistan - Ուզբեկստան (Armenian), Uzbekistāna (Latvian), Uzbekistanas (Lithuanian), Uzbekiston (Uzbek), Uzbekystan - Узбекистан (Ukrainian), Uzbequistão (Portuguese), Uzubekisutan - ウズベキスタン (Japanese), Wsbecistan (Welsh), Wūzībiékè - 烏茲別克 or Wūzībiékèsītǎn - 乌兹别克斯坦 (Chinese), உஸ்பெகிஸ்தான்[romanization needed] (Tamil), ازبکستان[romanization needed] (Urdu)
          V
          English name Names in different languages
          Vanuatu Banuatsu - バヌアツ (Japanese), Banuatu / Panuat'u - 바누아투 (Korean), Bhanuatu (Scots Gaelic), Fanuatû (West Frisian), Fanwātū - فانواتو‎ (Arabic), Fanwatw (Welsh), Panuatsu (Inuktitut), Uanuatu - Уануату (Kazakh), Va-nu-a-tu (Vietnamese), Vanouátou - Βανουάτου (Greek), Vanuatu (Afrikaans, Albanian, Aragonese, Asturian, Azeri, Basque, Bislama, Bosnian, Catalan, Cebuano, Cornish, Croatian, Czech, Danish, Dutch, Estonian, Faroese, Fijian Hindi, Finnish, Franco-Provençal, French, Galician, German, Hungarian, Indonesian, Italian, Javanese, Kapampangan, Latvian, Lithuanian, Maltese, Manx, Min Nan, Norwegian, Polish, Portuguese, Romanian, Slovene, Spanish, Swahili, Swedish, Turkish, Welsh variant), Vanuatú (Irish), Vanúatú (Icelandic), Vanûatû (Kurdish), Vanuatu - Вануату (Belarusian, Bulgarian, Kyrgyz, Macedonian, Ossetic, Russian, Serbian, Ukrainian), Vānūātū - वानूआतू (Hindi, Sanskrit), Vanuatuo (Esperanto), Vanuwatu - וונואטו‎ (Hebrew), Vanwatou (Haitian Creole), Wànnǎdù - 萬那杜 or Wǎnǔātú - 瓦努阿圖 or Wǎnǔwǎtú - 瓦努瓦图 (Chinese), Wanuatu - වනුආටු (Sinhala), Wanuwatu - วานูวาตู (Thai)

          Colonial name: Ha'Hebridim Ha'Khadashim - ההברידים החדשים‎ (Hebrew), Hebrides Anyar (Javanese), Hebrides Baru (Indonesian), Nées Evrídes – Nέες Εβρίδες (Greek), Neue Hebriden (German), New Hebrides (English), Nieuwe Hebriden (Dutch), Nio Heboridiso - นิวเฮบริดีส (Thai), Niwbrid - نيوهبريد‎ (Arabic), Noile Hebride (Romanian), Nouvelles-Hébrides (French), Novas Hébridas (Portuguese), Nové Hebridy (Czech, Slovak), Noves Hèbrides (Catalan), Novi Hebridi (Croatian), Novi Hebridi - Нови Хебриди (Bulgarian, Macedonian, Serbian), Novi Hebridy – Нові Гебріди (Ukrainian), Novyja Hiebrydy – Новыя Гебрыды (Belarusian), Novyye Gebridy – Новые Гебриды (Russian), Nowe Hebrydy (Polish), Nuevas Hébridas (Spanish), Nuove Ebridi (Italian), Ny Hebriderne (Danish), Nya Hebriderna (Swedish), Nye Hebridene (Norwegian), Nýju-Suðureyjar (Icelandic), Nyuhebeulidiseu – 뉴헤브리디스 (Korean), Nyūheburidīzu shotō – ニューヘブリディーズ諸島 (Japanese), Tân Đảo (Vietnamese), Új Hebridák (Hungarian), Uudet Hebridit (Finnish), Uus Hebriidid (Estonian), Xīn Hèbùlǐdǐ Qúndǎo – 新赫布里底群岛 (Chinese), Yeni Hebridler (Turkish), வனுவாட்டு[romanization needed] (Tamil), ونوواٹو[romanization needed] (Urdu)

          Vatican City a' Bhàtacan (Scots Gaelic variant), al-Fatikān - الفاتيكان‎ (Arabic), Bachikan Shikoku - バチカン市国 (Japanese), Batikan Siguk / Pat'ik'an Siguk - 바티칸 시국 (Korean), Cathair na Bhaticain (Scots Gaelic), Cidade do Vaticano (Portuguese), Civitas Vaticana or Vaticanum (Latin), Dinas y Fatican or Fatican (Welsh), Fàndìgāng - 梵蒂岡 (Chinese), Fatikaanstêd (West Frisian), il-Belt tal-Vatikan (Maltese), Kiryat ha'Vatikan - קרית הוותיקן‎ (Hebrew), Kota Vatikan (Indonesian variant), Nakhon Rat Watikan - นครรัฐวาติกัน (Thai), Patikan Iglurjuat (Inuktitut), Póli tou Vatikanoú - Πόλη του Βατικανού (Greek), Stát Chathair na Vatacáine (Irish), Va-ti-căng (Vietnamese), Vaticaanstad (Dutch), Vatican (French, Romanian), Vaticano (Italian, Portuguese, Spanish), Vatikaanivaltio (Finnish), Vatikaanstad (Afrikaans), Vatikan (Azeri, Estonian, Indonesian, Slovene variant, Turkish, Võro), Vatikán (Czech, Hungarian, Slovak), Vatikan - Ватикан (Macedonian, Russian, Serbian), Vatikan - װאַטיקאַן‎ (Yiddish), Vatikan Shikoku - ヴァティカン市国 (Japanese variant), Vatikana - Ватикана (Bulgarian), Vatikanas (Lithuanian), Vatikani (Albanian), Vatikanið (Faroese, Icelandic), Vatikano (Esperanto), Vatikanoa (Basque), Vatikāns (Latvian), Vatikanska mestna država (Slovene), Vatikanstadt (German), Vatikanstaten (Danish, Norwegian, Swedish), Vatikanu Nagaraya - වතිකානු නගරය (Sinhala), Vatykan - Ватикан (Ukrainian), Veṭikan - वेटिकन् (Hindi, Sanskrit), Watykan (Polish), வாடிகன் நகரம்[romanization needed] (Tamil), ویٹیکن[romanization needed] (Urdu)
          Venezuela a' Bheiniseala (Scots Gaelic), Benesuella / Penesuella - 베네수엘라 (Korean), Benezuera - ベネズエラ (Japanese), Feneswalia (Welsh), Fenzuwēlā - فنزويلا‎ (Arabic), il-Venezwela (Maltese), Pinitsuila (Inuktitut), Vê-nê-du-ê-la (Vietnamese), Venecuela - Венецуела (Bulgarian, Macedonian, Serbian), Venecuēla (Latvian), Venesuela (Faroese, Lithuanian), Venesuéla (Guaraní), Venesuela - Венесуэла (Russian), Venesuela - Венесуела (Ukrainian), Venetsueela (Estonian alternate), Venetzuela - ונצואלה‎ (Hebrew), Venezouéla - Βενεζουέλα (Greek), Venezuela (Afrikaans, Albanian, Czech, Danish, Dutch, Estonian, Finnish, French, German, Hungarian, Indonesian, Italian, Norwegian, Portuguese, Romanian, Slovak, Slovene, Spanish, Swedish, Turkish), Venezuelā - वेनेज़ुएला (Hindi, Sanskrit), Venezuelo (Esperanto), Wěinèiruìlā - 委內瑞拉 (Chinese), Wenesuela - เวเนซุเอลา (Thai), Wenezuela (Polish), Wenisiyulava - වෙනිසියුලාව (Sinhala), வெனிசுலா[romanization needed] (Tamil), وینزویلا[romanization needed] (Urdu)
          Vietnam Beteunam / Pet'ŭnam - 베트남 (Korean), Betonamu - ベトナム(越南) (Japanese), Bhiet-Nam (Scots Gaelic), Biyetnam (Tagalog), Campādeśah / Viyatanāma - चम्पादेशः / वियतनाम (Sanskrit), Etsunan - 越南 (former Japanese), Fiet-nam (Welsh), il-Vjetnam (Maltese variant), Piinnama (Inuktitut), Vetonamu - ヴェトナム (Japanese variant), Vienami (Guaraní), Viet Nam (French variant), Viêt Nam (French), Việt Nam (Vietnamese), Vietnã (Brazilian Portuguese), Viëtnam (Afrikaans), Vietnam (Albanian, Catalan, Czech, Danish, Dutch, Estonian, Finnish, French variant, German, Hungarian, Indonesian, Italian, Malay, Norwegian, Portuguese variant, Romanian, Slovak, Slovene, Spanish, Swedish, Turkish), Vietnam - Виетнам (Bulgarian, Macedonian), Vietnám - Βιετνάμ (Greek), Vietnam - ויאטנאם‎ (Hebrew), Vietnam - Վիետնամ (Armenian), gugdrvietnama (Lojban), Vietnamas (Lithuanian), Vietname (Portuguese), Vijetnam (Bosnian, Croatian), Vijetnam - Вијетнам (Serbian), Viyatnām - वियतनाम (Hindi), Viyitnām - فيتنام‎ (Arabic), Vjetnam (Faroese, Maltese), Vjetnama (Latvian), Vjetnamio (Esperanto), V'yetnam - В'єтнам (Ukrainian), Vyetnam - Вьетнам (Russian), Wennam - 윁남 (North Korean variant), Wiatnam - เวียดนาม (Thai), Wietnam (Polish), Wiyatnamaya - වියට්නාමය (Sinhala), Wollam / Wŏllam - 월남 (former Korean), Yuan - ญวน (alternative Thai), Yuènán - 越南 (Chinese), வியட்நாம்[romanization needed] (Tamil), ویتنام[romanization needed] (Urdu)
          W

          Wales a' Chuimrigh (Scots Gaelic), an Bhreatain Bheag (Irish), Cambria (Latin), Cymru (Welsh), Gales (Spanish), Galler (Turkish), Galles (Italian), Kembra (Cornish), Kimrio (Esperanto), Oualía - Ουαλία (Greek), País de Gales (Portuguese), País de Gaŀles (Catalan), Pays de Galles (French), Ţara Galilor (Romanian), Uaalusu (Inuktitut), Uellsi (Albanian), Uels - Уелс (Bulgarian), Uel's - Уельс (Ukrainian), Uėl's - Уэльс (Russian), Uēruzu - ウェールズ (Japanese), Vels - Велс (Macedonian, Serbian), Vels - वेल्स् (Hindi, Sanskrit), Velsa (Latvian), Velsas (Lithuanian), Veylz - װײלז‎ (Yiddish), Wales (Czech, Danish, Dutch, Estonian, Faroese, Finnish, German, Hungarian, Icelandic, Indonesian, Maltese, Norwegian, Romansh, Slovak, Slovene, Swedish), Wales or Valisa (Romansh), Walia (Polish), Wallis (Afrikaans), Wayls - ווילס‎ (Hebrew), Wēiěrsī - 威爾斯 (Chinese), Weilseu / Weilsŭ - 웨일스 (Korean), Wels - වේල්ස් (Sinhala), Wēlz - ويلز‎ (Arabic), Weo - เวลส์ (Thai), xứ Wales or Xứ Gan (Vietnamese), வேல்ஸ்[romanization needed] (Tamil), ویلز[romanization needed] (Urdu)
          Wallis and Futuna Oualís kai Foutouná - Ουαλίς και Φουτουνά (Greek), Uallas agus Futuna (Scots Gaelic), Uallisulu Putuna (Inuktitut), Uollis i Futuna - Уоллис и Футуна (Russian), Valis i Futuna - Валис и Футуна (Macedonian, Serbian), Valis ve'Futunna - ווליס ופוטונה‎ (Hebrew), Valiso kaj Futuno (Esperanto), Volisa un Futuna (Latvian), Volisas ir Futūna (Lithuanian), Vollis i Futuna - Волліс і Футуна (Ukrainian), Walis Lae Futuna - วาลิสและฟูตูนา (Thai), Wālīs wa Fūtūnā - واليس وفوتونا‎ (Arabic), Wǎlìsī jí Fùtúnà qúndǎo - 瓦利斯及富圖納群島 (Chinese), Wallis a Futuna (Czech), Wallis dan Futuna (Indonesian, Malay), Wallis dhe Futuna (Albanian), Wallis e Futuna (Italian, Portuguese), Wallis en Futuna (Dutch), Wallis és Futuna (Hungarian), Wallis-et-Futuna (French), Wallis i Futuna (Polish), Wallis ja Futuna (Estonian, Finnish), Wallis- och Futunaöarna (Swedish), Wallis og Futunaøerne (Danish), Wallis- og Futunaøyene (Norwegian), Wallis și Futuna (Romanian), Wallis u Futuna (Maltese), Wallis und Futuna (German), Wallis và Futuna (Vietnamese), Wallis ve Futuna Adaları (Turkish), Wallis y Futuna (Spanish), Walliseu Pwitwina / Wallisŭ P'wit'wina - 왈리스 퓌튀나 (Korean), Wælis saha Futuna - වැලිස් සහ ෆුටුනා (Sinhala), Worisu Futsuna - ウォリス・フツナ (Japanese), வாலிஸ் மற்றும் ஃப்யுடுனா[romanization needed] (Tamil), والِس و فٹونا[romanization needed] (Urdu)
          Western Sahara Arabiese Demokratiese Republiek Sahara (Afrikaans, name for partially recognized state), Batahira Sahara - බටහිර සහරා (Sinhala), Batı Sahra (Turkish), Dytikí Sahára - Δυτική Σαχάρα (Greek), Gorllewin Sahara (Welsh), Al-Jumhūrīyâ al-Arabīyâ as-Sahrāwīyâ ad-Dīmuqrātīyâ - الجمهورية العربية الصحراوية الديمقراطية‎ (Arabic, name for partially recognized state), is-Saħara tal-Punent (Maltese variant), Kanlurang Sahara (Filipino, Tagalog), Kanngaat Sahara (Inuktitut), Lääne-Sahara (Estonian), Länsi-Sahara (Finnish), Nishi Sahara - 西サハラ (Japanese), Nyugat-Szahara (Hungarian), Okcidenta Saharo (Esperanto), Paścimī Sahārā - पश्चिमी सहारा (Hindi, Sanskrit), Qərbi Səhra (Azeri), República Arabe Saharaui Democrática (Spanish, name for partially recognized state), Rietumsahāra (Latvian), Saara Ocidental (Portuguese), Sara Ocidental (Portuguese variant), Sahara an Iar (Scots Gaelic), Sahara Barat (Indonesian, Malay), Sahara Occidental (French, Spanish), Sahara Occidentală (Romanian), Sahara Occidentale (Italian), Sahara Ocidental (Portuguese variant), Sahara Perëndimore (Albanian), Saħara tal-Punent (Maltese), Sahara Zachodnia (Polish), Saharah Ha'Ma'aravit - סהרה המערבית‎ (Hebrew), As-Ṣaḥrā' al-Ġarbiyyah - الصحراء الغربية‎ (Arabic), Seosahara / Sŏsahara - 서사하라 (Korean), Tây Sahara (Vietnamese), Vakarų Sachara (Lithuanian), Västsahara (Swedish), Vest-Sahara (Norwegian), Vestsahara (Danish), Vestursahara (Faroese), Wes-Sahara (Afrikaans), Westelijke Sahara (Dutch), West-Sahara (German), Wésthôen Sahara, Westhoen Sahara - เวสเทิร์นสะฮารา (Thai), Xī Sāhālā - 西撒哈拉 (Chinese), Zahidna Sahara - Західна Сахара (Ukrainian), Zahodna Sahara (Slovene), Zapadna Sahara - Западна Сахара (Bulgarian, Macedonian, Serbian), Zapadnaya Sahara - Западная Сахара (Russian), Západní Sahara (Czech), மேற்கு சஹாரா[romanization needed] (Tamil), مغربی صحارا[romanization needed] (Urdu)
          Y
          English name Names in different languages
          Yemen an Eaman (Scots Gaelic), Iemen (Scots Gaelic variant, Welsh), Iemen - イエメン (Japanese), Iémen (Portuguese), Iêmen (Brazilian Portuguese), Iemenia or Iemenium (Latin), Iiman (Inuktitut), il-Jemen (Maltese), Jeemen (Estonian, Võro), Jemen (Afrikaans, Albanian, Bosnian, Croatian, Czech, Dutch, Faroese, Finnish, German, Hungarian, Norwegian, Polish, Slovak, Slovene), Jemen - Јемен (Macedonian, Serbian), Jemena (Latvian), Jemenas (Lithuanian), Jemeno (Esperanto), Teyman - תימן‎ (Hebrew), Teymen - תּימן‎ (Yiddish), Y-ê-men (Vietnamese), al-Yaman - اليمن‎ (Arabic), Yaman (Indonesian, Malay), Yaman - यमन (Hindi, Sanskrit), Yemanayay - යේමනයේ (Sinhala), Yemen (Catalan, Danish, Italian, Romanian, Spanish, Swedish, Turkish), Yémen (French), Yəmən (Azeri), Yemen - Йемен (Bulgarian, Russian), Yemen - 예멘 (Korean), Yemen - เยเมน (Thai), Yemen - Ємен (Ukrainian), Yèmén or Yěmén - 葉門 or 也門 (Chinese), Yemen - یمن (Urdu), Yeméni - Υεμένη (Greek), ஏமன்[romanization needed] (Tamil)
          Yugoslavia Dienvidslāvija (Latvian), Giougoslavía - Γιουγκοσλαβία (Greek), Haravslavia - հարավսլավիա (Armenian), il-Jugoslavja (Maltese), Iugoslabhia (Scots Gaelic), Iugoslavia (Romanian), Iugoslavia - იუგოსლავია (Georgian, Mingrelian), Iugoslávia (Portuguese), Iugoslàvia (Catalan), Iúgslaiv (Irish), Iwgoslavia (Welsh), Joegoslavië (Dutch), Jugoslaavia (Estonian), Jugoslavia (Finnish, Italian, Norwegian), Jugoslávie (Czech), Jugoslavien (Danish, Norwegian variant, Swedish), Júgóslavíu (Icelandic), Jugoslavija (Croatian, Lithuanian, Slovenian), Jugoslavija - Југославија (Macedonian, Serbian), Jugoslawien (German, Luxembourgish), Jugosllavia (Albanian), Jugosławia (Polish), Jugoszlávia (Hungarian), Juhaslavija - Юаславія (Belarusian), Juhoslávia (Slovak), Nán Sīlāfū - 南斯拉夫 (Chinese), Nam Tư - 南斯 or Nam Tư Lạp Phu - 南斯拉夫 (Vietnamese), Yougoslavie (French), Yughuslafia - يوغوسلافيا‎ (Arabic), Yugoseullabia - 유고 슬라비아 (Korean), Yugoslabiya (Indonesian, Malaysian, Tagalog), Yugoslavia (Spanish), Yugoslaviya - Югославия (Bulgarian, Russian), Yūgoslāviyā - यूगोस्लाविया (Hindi, Sanskrit), Yugoslavya (Turkish), Yugoslavya - יוגוסלביה‎ (Hebrew), Yūgosurabia - ユーゴスラビア (Japanese), Yuhoslaviya - Югославія (Ukrainian), Yukoslawei - ยูโกสลาเวีย (Thai), Yuqoslaviya (Azeri), یوگوسلاویہ[romanization needed] (Urdu)
          Z
          English name Names in different languages
          Zambia Dăm-bi-a (Vietnamese), Jambia / Chambia - 잠비아 (Korean), Saembia - แซมเบีย (Thai), Sæmbiyawa - සැම්බියාව (Sinhala), Sàimbia (Scots Gaelic), Sambia (Estonian, Faroese, Finnish, German, Welsh), Sammia (Inuktitut), Zambia (Albanian, Danish, Dutch, Hungarian, Indonesian, Italian, Malay, Norwegian, Polish, Romanian, Slovak, Slovene, Spanish, Swedish), Zâmbia (Portuguese), Zambia - זמביה‎ (Hebrew), Zambia - ザンビア (Japanese), Zambia - زیمبیا (Urdu), Zambie (Czech, French), Zambië (Afrikaans), Zambija (Croatian, Latvian, Lithuanian), Zambija - Замбија (Macedonian, Serbian), Zambio (Esperanto), Zambiya (Turkish), Zambiya - Замбия (Bulgarian, Russian), Zāmbiyā - ज़ाम्बिया (Hindi, Sanskrit), Zambiya - Замбія (Ukrainian), Zambiyā - زامبيا‎ (Arabic), iż-Żambja (Maltese), Zámpia - Ζάμπια (Greek), Zànbǐyà - 赞比亚 or Shàngbǐyà - 尚比亞 (Chinese), சாம்பியா[romanization needed] (Tamil)
          Zimbabwe Dim-ba-bu-ê (Vietnamese), Jimbabeuwe / Chimbabŭwe - 짐바브웨 (Korean), iż-Żimbabwe (Maltese), Jimbabue - ジンバブエ (Japanese), Jimmapui (Inuktitut), Jīnbābùwéi - 津巴布韦 or Xīnbāwēi - 辛巴威 (Chinese), Simbabvi or Gróthús (Faroese), Simbabway - සිම්බාබ්වේ (Sinhala), Simbabwe (German, Welsh), Simbapwe - ซิมบับเว (Thai), Siombabue (Scots Gaelic), Zimbabue (Portuguese variant, Spanish), Zimbábue (Portuguese), Zimbabué (Portuguese variant), Zimbabve (Croatian, Latvian, Slovene, Turkish), Zimbabvė (Lithuanian), Zimbabve - Зимбабве (Bulgarian, Macedonian, Russian, Serbian), Zimbabve - Зімбабве (Ukrainian), Zimbābve - ज़िंबाब्वे (Hindi, Sanskrit), Zimbabveja (Albanian), Zimbabvia (Latin), Zimbabvo (Esperanto), Zimbabwe (Afrikaans, Czech, Danish, Dutch, Estonian, Finnish, French, Hungarian, Indonesian, Italian, Malay, Norwegian, Polish, Portuguese variant, Romanian, Slovak, Swedish), Zimbabwe - זימבבואה‎ (Hebrew), Zimbabwe - زمبابوے (Urdu), Zīmbābwī - زيمبابوي‎ (Arabic), Zimpámpue - Ζιμπάμπουε (Greek), ஜிம்பாப்வே[romanization needed] (Tamil)
